Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of [99m Tc]Tilmanocept for Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping in Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: The study was nonrandomized, and all patients received both interventions.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at 13 centers, 148 breast cancer patients without presurgical lymph node metastases were enrolled.

Intervention.evidence: Each received [99m Tc]tilmanocept and vital blue dye (VBD).

Objective.evidence: This study assesses [99m Tc]tilmanocept, a novel receptor-targeted radiopharmaceutical, in SLN mapping.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the concordance of SLN detection between [99m Tc]tilmanocept and VBD, measured intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The study was nonrandomized, and all patients received both interventions.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 148 breast cancer patients without presurgical lymph node metastases were enrolled.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 148 patients, 207 of 209 nodes detected by VBD were also detected by [99m Tc]tilmanocept.

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were attributed to [99m Tc]tilmanocept. Adverse events were mild and included nausea and seroma.
